titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2606) to prohibit the use of funds appropriated to the Department of Defense from being used for the deployment on the ground of United States Armed Forces in the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina as part of any peacekeeping operation, or as any implementation force, unless funds for such deployment are specifically appropriated by law.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-349, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2606 with 1 hour of general debate. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill and any amendment thereto without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate on the bill, (2) one motion to amend by the Minority Leader or his designee, (3) one motion to recommit, which may include instructions only if offered by the Minority Leader or his designee. If the Minority Leader or his designee announces that an amendment will not be offered there shall be an additional one hour of debate. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 128.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 239 - 181 (Roll no. 813).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/16/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the modified closed rule for the consideration of H.R. 2606 (prohibition on the use of Department of Defense appropriations for the deployment of U.S. armed forces in Bosnia and Herzegovina).
